Sentencas: Using DFT methods, we have studied CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction at the presence of molten carbonate in the cathode of fuel cells.
Titulo: DFT study of CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction with the presence of molten carbonate in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The binding energy of CO2 to O-2(2-) is calculated to be 143 kcal mol(-1), showing that peroxide plays an important role in the reduction of CO2 in MCFCs.
Titulo: DFT study of CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction with the presence of molten carbonate in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The formation of CO52- from CO32- and O-2 is exothermic, with an energy change of -24.3 kcal mol(-1), which is comparable to the adsorption energy of oxygen on the defect sites of the LSM cathode of SOFCs.
Titulo: DFT study of CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction with the presence of molten carbonate in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For 2CO(3)(2-) + O-2 = 2CO(4)(2-,) the equilibrium constant at 873 K is estimated to be 1.1 and CO42- is thermodynamically favored.
Titulo: DFT study of CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction with the presence of molten carbonate in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The formation of CO42- and CO52- has significantly decreased the reduction potential of oxygen and will promote the ORR process in SOFCs.
Titulo: DFT study of CO42- and CO52- relevant to oxygen reduction with the presence of molten carbonate in solid oxide fuel cells
